421685E041AB4142ADEE25322A268E93.description: Design and use a simulation to generate frequencies for compound events.

D2135FF20C65437DA4A8E49E597E68A7.description: For an event described in everyday language, identify the outcomes in the sample space which compose the event, when the sample space is represented using organized lists, tables, and tree diagrams.

F7FE031F53C44AF89663E47EC9DB1DDA.description: Understand that, just as with simple events, the probability of a compound event is the fraction of outcomes in the sample space for which the compound event occurs

7EF36AF072AF4A9AB3273E2D5CD64DC8.description: Determine probabilities of compound events using organized lists, tables, tree diagrams, and simulation

15E060D5DBFA4331ACDDB2D4B99804C3.description: Compare theoretical and experimental probabilities from a model to observed frequencies; if the agreement is not good, explain possible sources of the discrepancy.

7BAE1F163F304601AC0B7A1099788ED4.description:
Develop a probability model (which may not be uniform) by repeatedly performing a chance process and observing
frequencies in the data generated.

C16BAF9F87384BCA9C9EC6F64B6C5EC4.description:
Develop a uniform probability model by assigning equal probability to all outcomes, and use the model to determine
probabilities of events.

935D728A3C974DFF8ACD8C6C8E7CE332.description: Develop a probability model and use it to find probabilities of simple events.

7CC7EEF4FAE643838217DF98BB8745D7.description: Collect data to calculate the experimental probability of a chance event, observing its long-run relative frequency. Use this experimental probability to predict the approximate relative frequency.

8AF2993F041C467EAF1C30182375C983.description: Understand that the probability of a chance event is a number between 0 and 1 that expresses the likelihood of the event occurring

FAF54A880DC243A8A1B70C66DA4C675D.description: Investigate chance processes and develop, use, and evaluate probability models.

7DD4DD361F07468EBF8CF0ECB1E45600.description: Use measures of center and measures of variability for numerical data from random samples to draw comparative inferences about two populations.

75A879AC9DA24603968384C36ABE6704.description: Informally assess the difference between two data sets by examining the overlap and separation between the graphical representations of two data sets.

441066D2F9604EE3AD6409263FD879F4.description:
Calculate the measure of variability of a data set and understand that it describes how the values of the data set vary with
a single number.
o Understand the mean absolute deviation of a data set is a measure of variability that describes the average distance
that points within a data set are from the mean of the data set.
o Understand that the range describes the spread of the entire data set.
o Understand that the interquartile range describes the spread of the middle 50% of the data

FD2169E8F8E74F0689B1453A8B06CB54.description: Recognize the role of variability when comparing two populations

CA15976E5BA94F1785E1F1E8209FF8EC.description: Make informal inferences to compare two populations.

F90919DD5DA045E0A5FF86E30EDEB8A1.description: Generate multiple random samples (or simulated samples) of the same size to gauge the variation in estimates or predictions, and use this data to draw inferences about a population with an unknown characteristic of interest.

6851E7CC7716432082F203A17A2F13B2.description: Using random sampling to produce representative samples to support valid inferences

23CCE586521B487E910D8A3EA1ACA0A9.description: Recognizing that generalizations about a population from a sample are valid only if the sample is representative of that population.

48FA6714CA6A4D2D91B92BAED0E60ACE.description: Understand that statistics can be used to gain information about a population by:

B3A12CD9C7904419886EC688C1ADCB44.description: Use random sampling to draw inferences about a population.

9BEF09B06D8D44D1A0CEB69BD964EDE1.description: Volume and surface area of pyramids, prisms, or three-dimensional objects composed of cubes, pyramids, and right prisms.

4E6E9A9E9EDC46CA89A657E55A323113.description: Area and perimeter of two-dimensional objects composed of triangles, quadrilaterals, and polygons.

08FAC10CB87B4386BE666545BBFB3B6D.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving:

6562C9D1609F4EF0AC4A8B0C0F3C0443.description: Use facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles in a multi-step problem to write and solve equations for an unknown angle in a figure.

6F68C27B7CF648EEA02125FB5D1E334C.description: Apply the formulas for area and circumference of a circle to solve problems.

54757BEB2E27430CAB46B065F7EAB08A.description: Understand the relationships between the radius, diameter, circumference, and area.

988088B317DB4966BBFD3678FB7BE9C4.description: Understand area and circumference of a circle.

7668024E64C141938900E05655F979B1.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving angle measure, area, surface area, and volume

97E91DC6831B4655B94692060FAC82D5.description: Understand the characteristics of angles and side lengths that create a unique triangle, more than one triangle or no triangle. Build triangles from three measures of angles and/or sides.

0EDEED19B2704B03A37AD88FA31ECD81.description: Using a scale factor to compute actual lengths and areas from a scale drawing.

1534E60A5A14439286D03D713A7BCD51.description: Building an understanding that angle measures remain the same and side lengths are proportional.

EB9639D0504D4C3F96C22241E6F2AA43.description: Solve problems involving scale drawings of geometric figures by:

7BF80DFA683C46D68B2F6331A1AB3B4D.description: Draw, construct, and describe geometrical figures and describe the relationships between them.

70169C3023DB444682462431A55DD923.description:
Construct inequalities to solve problems by reasoning about the quantities.
o Fluently solve multi-step inequalities with the variable on one side, including those generated by word problems.
o Compare an algebraic solution process for equations and an algebraic solution process for inequalities.
o Graph the solution set of the inequality and interpret in context.

179E12A1473447A8B7BC27936A765D31.description:
Construct equations to solve problems by reasoning about the quantities. 
o Fluently solve multistep equations with the variable on one side, including those generated by word problems. 
o Compare an algebraic solution to an arithmetic solution, identifying the sequence of the operations used in each approach. 
o Interpret the solution in context.

819D5386AFDB42F5BD802678FAA0E28B.description: Use variables to represent quantities to solve real-world or mathematical problems.

65F1666B8848419A8FC5EEC2173E448C.description: Convert between different forms of a number and equivalent forms of the expression as appropriate.

D749DED2B3B24A67A721B23F92C29951.description: Apply propoerties of operations to calculate with positive and negative numbers in any form.

830687881C8B41318BBF4461CEB4A1AB.description:
Solve multi-step real-world and mathematical problems posed with rational numbers in algebraic expressions.
• Apply properties of operations to calculate with positive and negative numbers in any form.
• Convert between different forms of a number and equivalent forms of the expression as appropriate

D4F227B3C4AC475BAC5D15ECC63022C8.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems using numerical and algebraic expressions, equations, and inequalities.

25458CC3EA7F4204AE2971075CB73A90.description: Understand that equivalent expressions can reveal real-world and mathematical relationships. Interpret the meaning of the parts of each expression in context.

7C75328B4E114145A549269631A082AF.description: Factor linear expression with an integer GCF.

69025F34008941FE899B8B744304E33F.description: Add, subtract, and expand linear expressions with rational coefficients.

9D2C4FFBB27746DFAFF3246EF20DC214.description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to:

99316484B64B4DAFA6D9B51A1FECBFD9.description: Use properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.

4E18447C86B9412785F06B776A30A085.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving numerical expressions with rational numbers using the four operations.

2FB879C1402C4D4EA8DB917A34C6EB53.description:
Use division and previous understandings of fractions and decimals. 
o Convert a fraction to a decimal using long division. 
o Understand that the decimal form of a rational number terminates in 0s or eventually repeats.

57081EB6D85C4D96829BA4A1B37003E9.description:
Apply properties of operations as strategies, including the standard algorithms, to multiply and divide rational numbers
and describe the product and quotient in real-world contexts

17D70EEFD66343BCB778B26B6E37D9AC.description: Understand that a rational number is any number that can be written as a quotient of integers with a non-zero divisor

3F923BC902A94F4E8482400BF4DD83ED.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of operations with fractions to add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers.

FC814817A6FC46B789AB0E319BF0AA35.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers, using the properties of operations, and describing real-world contexts using sums and differences.

95B6CBE108C648DDB9419D17CB31264F.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of operations with fractions to add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers.

71236BDC2D03449BA7D753D7781461A2.description: Use scale factors and unit rates in proportional relationships to solve ratio and percent problems

0E80F33BA2FC463989713DE1EEDA85BF.description:
. Use a graphical representation of a proportional relationship in context to: 
o Explain the meaning of any point (0,0). 
o Explain the meaning of (0, 0) and why it is included. 
o Understand that the y-coordinate of the ordered pair (1, r) corresponds to the unit rate and explain its meaning.

09E19F16FAD3450B97D62CA7FDA71448.description: Create equations and graphs to represent proportional relationships.

BAB2E301FF914762B5469FEF0CDEBB87.description: Identify the unit rate (constant of proportionality) within two quantities in a proportional relationship using tables, graphs, equations, and verbal descriptions.

8B0A0F1E03F8481F83D67C9FC202A377.description:
Understand that a proportion is a relationship of equality between ratios. 
o Represent proportional relationships using tables and graphs. 
o Recognize whether ratios are in a proportional relationship using tables and graphs. 
o Compare two different proportional relationships using tables, graphs, equations, and verbal descriptions

3BAC077DDEEE4D18A0DE238529D75E02.description: Recognize and represent proportional relationships between quantities.

D2F3873AEAFE45979EF54DB45B925BD8.description: Compute unit rates associated with ratios of fractions to solve real-world and mathematical problems

90CC0CCEB7EF40D98D4108FA603762E9.description: Analyze proportional relationships and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems

07A4BD71DD8E421F9660BE1608A4CD1B.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

9BBB3A13FF944F68AA3BFE75557E4F88.description: Look for and make use of structure.

AED7B2F9AEB04AFFBDB4F0475964CE83.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

825F3FE487D14D41912F993BF5D77399.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

C1F6447F921E467CA02B010AFAEB9A27.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math Grade 6 (2018)
